TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ListItemsCollectionEditor extends System.ComponentModel.Design.CollectionEditor

Docs.summary: Provides a component editor for objects in a control that is derived from the or a similar control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor> class provides a user interface for editing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> elements of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> object within a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> or a similar control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor> is invoked by selecting the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **ListItems** property in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances%2A> method always returns `false` to indicate that only one object can be selected at a time in the editor. The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor.HelpTopic%2A> property returns the name of the Help topic that the editor displays.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.ComponentModel.EditorAttribute> class to associate the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor> class and the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.UITypeEditor> class (the collection editor's base class) with a custom `ListItems` property.
[!code-csharp[Design.WebControls_CollectionEditorSamples#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Design.WebControls_CollectionEditorSamples/CS/WebControlDesignerCollectionEditors.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Design.WebControls_CollectionEditorSamples#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/Design.WebControls_CollectionEditorSamples/VB/webcontroldesignercollectioneditors.vb#3)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Type type) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The of the collection to edit.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor> class when you select the ellipsis (**…**) button on the **ListItems** property in the **Properties** grid of the visual designer, when designing a control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl> class or other control that encapsulates a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemCollection> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool CanSelectMultipleInstances() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function CanSelectMultipleInstances () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether multiple elements can be selected at one time.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor.CanSelectMultipleInstances%2A> method always returns `false`; thus, only one <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem> object can be selected at a time in the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor> object.

MemberSignature.Value: Protected Overrides ReadOnly Property HelpTopic As String
protected: virtual property System::String ^ HelpTopic { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the Help topic to display for the object.
Docs.value: A that specifies the Help topic to display.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor.HelpTopic%2A> property gets the name of the Help topic to display when the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.ListItemsCollectionEditor> dialog box **Help** button is clicked or when the **F1** key is pressed.

block.para: Override the property to display a different Help topic.
